conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible side/top faces, and ceiling removed to show interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and cutaway; walls read as solid with corners and thickness. Minor simplification of some wall tops/edges and slightly uneven cutaway cleanliness in a few areas.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency mostly match (dining upper-left, kitchen upper-center, living right, bedroom lower-left, bath core, stair zone lower-right). Some partitions/openings are simplified and a few wall segments/room proportions (notably the kitchen/entry zone) look less faithful to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present in dining/living/bedroom and bathroom fixtures are present. Kitchen is largely missing key elements (counters/appliances) compared to the 2D plan, reducing room identity.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with readable walls/floors and good visibility. Materials are consistent and there are no obvious broken meshes; openings are somewhat hard to interpret in a couple of locations due to simplification.

detected_errors.description: Kitchen/entry partitioning and some room proportions appear simplified or shifted relative to the 2D plan, reducing strict layout fidelity.
Not all doors/openings are clearly represented with correct swing/location; several transitions read as generic gaps rather than specific door placements.
Kitchen fixtures are largely absent, making the kitchen less identifiable versus the 2D plan layout.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway with strong depth and wall geometry, but with moderate simplifications in kitchen/entry layout and incomplete door/kitchen element fidelity.
